2B50A2C0.Line7.EECAE: Though unfortunately, that means these poor souls will never truly find rest. Ah, well. At least you've brought the cleaver to me, so I can keep it safe from any more... victims.

344E826F.VoiceDir9.EECAE: Spooky, as if telling a tale; a bit gleeful

5D73363A.Line1.EECAE: You don't say! Who was he? A husband? A lover? I can't say I'm surprised.

667115E9.VoiceDir3.EECAE: Like a storyeller spinning a tale; a bit dramatic

915C293E.Line5.EECAE: Then, in order to keep them together forever, she'd consume their flesh so they'd never be apart. Aww.

9A5A08ED.Mischievous. He's not that torn up about: :  as he delights in the dark history of these artifacts.

C5451C42.Line9.EECAE: Legend has it she was corrupted by wild jealousy - no doubt the work of the cleaver - and inevitably offed every last partner and paramour.

F767AFBC.Line3.EECAE: Khaliun came to be known far and wide for the number of lovers she had, each disappearing after the next...
